Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: The school reports that the child was caught bullying a classmate, and the mother needs to respond
Expectation2: Follow safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries on site
Situation2: Before starting structural work, the carpenter needs to inspect and maintain tools and equipment to ensure safety and efficiency
Story: I was halfway through checking the circular saw’s blade when my phone buzzed with the school’s number. My heart sank. The principal’s voice was tight: my son had been caught bullying a classmate. They needed me to come in, now, to discuss what happened and how we’d move forward. I looked at the half-assembled frame and the scattered tools around me. The crew was waiting for my inspection before we could start—if I left, the whole site would be at a standstill, and rushing the safety check wasn’t an option. But my son needed me, and I couldn’t ignore the school’s call. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—my responsibility to keep my team safe, and my duty as a mother to guide my child through a mistake. My hands trembled as I tried to decide which role needed me more in this moment.
